Name: Tessmanian Devil
Ingredients: 1 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
1 dash Hot pepper sauce (red vinegar-based e.g. Tabasco)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Prepare garnish of two fresh red chilli peppers positioned as devil's horns on rim.
Review: The "devil" is in this cocktail's hot spice. Obviously the garnish should not be eaten.
History: Adapted from a recipe created by Tess Posthumus, Amsterdam, The Netherlands. To quote Tess, "A little devil in a glass. My first cocktail that made it onto the Door 74 menu back in 2010 and made it into Gaz Regan's 101 Best New Cocktails 2011."
